content.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
content.text: In 1989, Germany began the process of reunification and many soviet states began democratizing. Some wondered whether the Intelligence Community was needed any longer. The Intelligence Community began refocusing its efforts on transnational threats and Congress proposed a new Intelligence Community structure, and with less personnel.

content.title: The Gulf War
content.text: Having focused on the Soviet Union for so long, the Intelligence Community was unprepared to support military operations in the Gulf region. After the war ended the Joint Intelligence Center was established to provide crisis support for military operations. Problems arose with conflicting CIA and military assessments of the damage caused by allied bombing during the course of the gulf war.
